title: Bangalore - the city of old temples, churches, gardens, and lavish shopping malls
text:
Travel Articles | August 4, 2015 
Bangalore is a thriving commerce and IT city in south India. It is the capital of Karnataka and a major educational hub. The city is also a popular tourist destination with attractions that stun the tourists in a pleasant manner. Visit the city for a memorable vacation and pick from the best Bangalore hotels. 

Bangalore, the city famous for software industries, beautiful garden boulevards, and large number of government offices, is the capital city of Karnataka. It is one of the most developed cities in the country and ranks as the third most populated Indian city. The weather here is known for being pleasant and cool and the elevation is probably the highest amongst all major Indian cities. It has also been rated amongst the best places in India to live and is particularly noted for its modern lifestyle. The city tops not just in terms of having the highest concentration of IT Companies, but also in terms of the concentration of pubs and bars and educational institutions. 
Finding a suitable hotel in Bangalore is easy. There are all types of hotels and other lodging options that one will find ideal to their budget and stay needs. Most of the Bangalore hotels are situated in the main commerce centre that have excellent connectivity with major tourist attractions, railway station, and airport. Plus, there are a few located little away from the city centre and are perfect for tranquil vacation. 
Although Bangalore is generally seen as an IT city and an educational hub, there is still plenty to see and relish. Visiting the conventional sightseeing spots is the most popular activity here. Most importantly, the old monumental places are the prime sightseeing sites of the city and are simply worth visiting. The major landmarks, temples, structures etc. include: Dodda Ganapathi, Gavi Gangadeshwara Cave Temple, Ragigudda, Tipu Sultan's Palace, Dakshina Mukhy Nandeeshwara Temple,Vidhana Soudha, Bangalore Palace, Vasanthapura, Sri Raja Rajeshwari Temple, Dodda Ganapathi, Sri Ramakrishna Ashram, Shelter House Church, St. Francis Xavier's Cathedral, and Holy Trinity Church. 
The city is also generating a lot of attention as an ideal adventure holiday destination. There are a number of clubs offering activities like kayaking, rock climbing, camping, go-karting, frisbee competitions, cave exploration, hiking, cycling, and hill climbing. 
Travelers who seek to spent sometime exploring and understanding city's culture tend to visit Ranga Shankara, Jagriti Theater, and Bangalore Palace Grounds. They are the venues of various art and theater events providing a glimpse on the culture of the city. Plus, Kadlekai Parishe, Aero India, and Chitra Santhe are the other popular haunts amongst the tourists with similar taste for culture. 
Apart from these, there are a couple of interesting tourist destinations nearby, such as Ulsoor Lake, Wayanad, Tirupati, Mysore City, Ooty, and Coorg. Located about 40 k.m. from the centre of the city Kempegowda International Airport is the city's own airport. It is a large airport, busy with frequent flights, and amongst the best airports in the country. There are large number of hotels near Bangalore international airport offering satisfactory stay at reasonable price. Flights from Delhi, Mumbai, Pune etc. are amongst the busiest flight routes, so advance booking is advised. Besides, reaching the city via trains is very convenient as there are 4 major railway stations and each is severed with regular trains from all major Indian cities. For the locals of nearby cities and towns, roads are the budget friendly modes to access Bangalore. The government operated buses are reliable and cheap. Plus, there are a couple of privately owned intra-city buses running as well.
